executive_summary: An expert witness is a specialist consultant engaged by a law firm to provide expert opinion about a specific legal case. Expert witnesses often provide expert witness services to supplement their occupation as a university academic, consultant or specialist. Expert witnesses earn a significant share of their income when they testify in court or provide consultation to a lawyer.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Demand for Legal Services Has Been Fostering Long-Term Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Greater corporate complexity has boosted demand for legal services, as more property and departments have increased litigation because of more disputes. As litigation has risen, spending on expert witness consulting services has also surged, fostering long-term revenue growth. Continuously rising incomes have enabled more businesses and households to be able to afford the industry's services, also aiding revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 CAUSED CORPORATE PROFIT TO PLUMMET
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, state and local governments implemented social distancing laws and forced some businesses to shut down. Since companies couldn't operate normally, corporate profit plunged. Businesses lost excess income when profit fell, so many couldn't afford expert witness consulting services anymore, causing revenue growth to slow in 2020. Consistently rising demand for legal services still kept revenue growing during the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COURT CASES SURGED DURING THE PANDEMIC RECOVERY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Legal hearings were conducted online during COVID-19, so proceedings fell drastically in 2020. As the pandemic ended, court hearings were conducted in person again, so the number of proceedings soared. More proceedings raised demand for expert witness consulting services in 2021, so revenue soared in that year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: RISING INTEREST RATES HAVE DISCOURAGED PRIVATE INVESTMENT
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: To combat high inflation, the Federal Reserve has been raising interest rates. Higher interest rates have made it more difficult for companies to borrow money, so aggregate private investment has declined. Lower aggregate private investment has decreased the number of property rights disputes, tort cases and other forms of litigation, so demand for expert witness consulting services has fallen, causing revenue to creep downward in 2023.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE MARKET WILL BECOME MORE SATURATED
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the level of corporate litigation starts to level off, demand for legal services will grow at a slower pace. Lower demand for legal services will hamper revenue growth relative to the current period. Since market saturation will rise, expert witness consulting service providers must gain new revenue streams by offering good services at lower prices instead of simply finding new customers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STEADILY RISING INCOMES WILL RAISE CORPORATE PROFIT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, GDP is expected to grow steadily during the outlook period. Higher GDP will cause incomes to rise, boosting corporate profit since consumers with higher incomes will generate more sales for businesses. More profit will give companies more cash, enabling them to spend more on expert witness consultants, raising revenue for the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: HIGHER STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT INVESTMENT WILL AMPLIFY A VITAL REVENUE STREAM FOR THE INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As wages rise during the outlook period, state and local tax revenue will increase, boosting state and local government investment. More government investment will raise the number of property rights disputes, intellectual property filings and other disputes agencies have. More litigation will increase demand for expert witness consulting, so rising state and local government investment will amplify an existing revenue stream for the industry.

industry_definition: This industry provides witnesses to offer expertise and specialized knowledge within particular subject areas in court cases. This doesn't include in-house expert witnesses from firms that have a general counsel or legal team.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: There's significant competition among expert witness consulting service providers since there are lots of establishments. Companies compete primarily on reputation and price.
There are a few substitutes that compete with the industry. These include in-house producers of expert witness consulting services, management consultants, accountants and economic consultants.
Revenue during the current period has soared as demand for legal services has skyrocketed. The industry has also benefited from rising.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The industry primarily sells to businesses, as demand from corporations comprises more than two-thirds of revenue. Businesses hire expert witness consultants to assist in litigation, which often involves settling property rights, competition law and tort law disputes.

The industry helps the state by acting as expert witnesses for federal, state and local governments in disputes with corporations and individuals. Service providers also give testimony on legislation and other government initiatives.

Individuals and households use expert witness consulting services for bankruptcy, intellectual property, employment and tax litigation. The industry provides extensive information to individuals so they can be prepared when they appear in court.
Some nonprofit organizations use expert witness consulting services, as they seek expert opinion in various forms of litigation.

products_and_services.product_description: Expert witness testimony in court comprises the largest revenue share since fees for these services are high.

Corporations hire expert witness consulting service providers to perform consultation services. Providers do research to brief attorneys on technical issues that are essential to the cases they're working on.

Expert witness consultants review documents, which involves analyzing information related to the lawsuit, such as medical records, accounting books, transcripts and footage of events. Report preparation relates to writing and sending reports to the court that will become available as a source of reference for litigation proceedings.

tier_2_suppliers: Office Furniture Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Revenue for expert witness consulting services is largely determined by demand from the Law Firms industry. An increase in demand from law firms implies more lawsuits, which often require expert witness consulting.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region contains many of the nation's major banks, private equity firms and financial institutions. Since the Washington Metropolitan Area is part of the Mid-Atlantic, government agencies are prominent in the region also.

The West region, specifically California, is home to Silicon Valley, which comprises the nation's largest technology companies. The largest technology companies (e.g., Alphabet, Apple, Meta) are heavily regulated, so they engage in lots of litigation.

The Southeast region is home to big states such as Florida, Georgia, Virginia and North Carolina, which makes the region populated. Since the area contains many people, there's a high penetration of businesses, individuals and organizations. Naturally, some of these groups demand expert witness consulting services, so many companies locate in this region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: There aren't any government-issued licenses required to become an expert witness consultant. Many players hold International Organization for Standardization (ISO) accreditation and certification to consult public-sector agencies and large corporations. Most have ISO 9000 accreditations, as they relate to quality management systems.

The ABA sets standards for lawyers and law firms. Since many employees in this industry are lawyers or work directly with them, they're affected by ABA rules. Lawyers must be registered with the ABA in the state where they practice. They also must meet the required qualifications and ethical standards set by the ABA to practice law.

Federal Rule of Evidence 702 states that expert testimony must improve the understanding of evidence in federal court. Expert witness consultants must ensure their research is relevant before presenting it in federal court.

basis_points.basis_description: There's significant competition among expert witness consulting service providers since there are lots of establishments.
Companies compete primarily on reputation and price.
There are a few substitutes that compete with the industry. These include in-house producers of expert witness consulting services, management consultants, accountants and economic consultants.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Some companies, individuals and agencies demand specific litigation services, so small expert witness consulting service providers often specialize in providing one specific service. These providers gain specific expertise in offering this one type of service, so they're able to compete with prominent players, boosting the number of nonemployers and small companies.

It's relatively easy to open an expert witness consulting service business, as capital costs are very low. Since heavy investment in capital isn't required, many small players enter the industry, which reduces consolidation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases include computers, software and subscriptions to third-party databases. These investments are used to provide effective research for clients. These purchases remain pretty constant over time, so purchase costs' revenue share has been stable during the current period.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Miscellaneous costs have displayed some volatility
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs include travel costs, insurance fees and legal services. Miscellaneous costs' revenue share fell during COVID-19 as fewer employees traveled to meet clients but rose amid the recovery as travel picked up again. Overall, other costs have been fairly stable during the current period.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Since capital costs are very low and providers need workers with extensive knowledge and skills, labor intensity provides a much higher barrier to entry.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Corporate profit is a measure of how much excess income companies have. When profit is high, corporations can afford to spend more on expert witness consulting services since they have the available funds. Declining profit reduces revenue since many companies can't afford to pay for the industry's services anymore.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Interest Rates Affect Aggregate Private Investment
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since many companies borrow to purchase capital, the interest rate determines the level of aggregate private investment. When interest rates are high, aggregate private investment falls. As rates fall, private investment soars.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Big Data Has Improved Document Review
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Some expert witness consulting service providers have used artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze and categorize documents, extract meaningful information and identify patterns. AI enables the industry to go through documents more quickly. Data visualization has also helped identify relationships and patterns between documents. Providers use big data to sift through documents more effectively, enabling them to give better consultation services to their clients.

FAQs.question: Does your company offer a broad range of services or does it specialize in a singular, niche service?
FAQs.answer: Expert witness consultants provide clients with niche services pertaining to the particular type of service they have studied for many years.

FAQs.question: How have recent economic conditions influenced consumer demand for your company's services?
FAQs.answer: As macroeconomic conditions improve and corporations are more profitable, demand for consultants' services tends to increase.

FAQs.question: What is your company's most significant operational expense?
FAQs.answer: Wages are the highest operational expenses for expert witness consultants, as they need the work of highly skilled employees to provide consulting services.

FAQs.question: To what degree is your company's operations capital intensive?
FAQs.answer: Highly skilled workers do expert witness consulting with little capital.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Web-based technologies have helped consultants better understand potential clients' needs before entering into a contract to work with them. There have been few technological advances that have meaningfully increased marketing consultants' efficiencies.

FAQs.question: Have you minimized/reduced wage costs by automating your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: Since consultancy work is heavily reliant upon the input of highly skilled and educated workers, automation is next to nonexistent.

FAQs.question: Has the regulatory environment experienced significant change, or has it remained relatively stable?
FAQs.answer: Regulations have increased recently, which has led companies to demand these types of services to make sure they are complying with new laws.

FAQs.question: Does your company struggle to finance its ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: Expert witness consultants tend to work alone, requiring little to no financing for their operations.

FAQs.question: How does your company become more profitable?
FAQs.answer: As consultants' services have become more specialized, they've gained pricing power over businesses. This has enabled profit to expand.

FAQs.question: How do you make sure your prices are attractive to customers? Who is your biggest competition based on pricing?
FAQs.answer: Most consultancy tasks are subject to competition, so competitiveness in price and service offerings is crucial.

FAQs.question: Do you have systems in place to keep standards high and continually updating? If you have made mistakes, how did you deal with them?
FAQs.answer: The effectiveness of consulting activities is often easily measured, making it simple for clients to assess the value of consulting services.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain qualified staff? What qualifications must your staff have? Does your staff undergo constant training?
FAQs.answer: Consulting contracts are often entered into based on the consultant's specialized knowledge of clients' operations. Without this skill base, the consulting firm has little bargaining power.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor corporate profit? How much of your revenue is derived from businesses?
FAQs.answer: Corporate entities are major users of expert witness consulting services. Corporations use expert witness consultants when contending with civil lawsuits.

FAQs.question: How heavily does your company rely on a high crime rate for revenue? How has the declining crime rate affected your revenue?
FAQs.answer: The crime rate represents the total reported violent and property crimes per 100,000 people. Since reported crimes typically go through litigation, which can call for expert witness consulting services, an increase in the crime rate boosts revenue.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue depends on demand from law firms? Do you have contacts with any reputable law firms?
FAQs.answer: Expert witness consulting services depend on demand from law firms. An increase in demand from law firms signals more lawsuits, which can require expert witness consulting.
